about_the_game:
This is the soundtrack Vol. 2 of World for Two.
The soundtrack includes new tracks written for the Prequel, the story of the Professor's past, and piano quintet performances of "Lagoon", "Forest", "Sand Dunes", "Snow Ruins" and "Daydreaming" from the main story.

In addition, the album includes "Daydreaming - String Quartet" and "Snow Ruins - Piano Solo" (not featured in the game), making it an acoustic album for piano and strings.
We hope you enjoy the different sounds of the synthesizers, the piano solo, and the pixel art that we have created for the cover of this album.

Composer: Daisuke Shiiba

1st Violin: Asuka Kobayashi
2nd Violin: Moe Aoyagi
Viola: Mio Shirakabe
Violoncello: Ayumi Shimizu
Piano: Shoko Iida
Recording & Mixing Engineer: Yoshiaki Kondoh [GOK SOUND, Kichijoji] (Kichijoji, Japan)
Artwork Design: Haf-Haf-Oden
Special Thanks: Shinichi Nishimori and Masashi Kimura

This is the soundtrack Vol. 2 of World for Two.
The soundtrack includes new tracks written for the Prequel, the story of the Professor's past, and piano quintet performances of "Lagoon", "Forest", "Sand Dunes", "Snow Ruins" and "Daydreaming" from the main story.

In addition, the album includes "Daydreaming - String Quartet" and "Snow Ruins - Piano Solo" (not featured in the game), making it an acoustic album for piano and strings.
We hope you enjoy the different sounds of the synthesizers, the piano solo, and the pixel art that we have created for the cover of this album.
